krispyjala wrote:
> Hello,
>    I'm running into this problem where the PrivilegedAccessor cannot
> find the method when using invokeMethod() if the Object array
> contains a null value.
> 
> Ex:
> 
> PrivilegedAccessor.invokeMethod(Class.class,"myMethod",new Object[]
> {null,arg1});
> 
> I think the problem lies in the fact that underneath, invokeMethod's
> calling getMethod which calls another getMethod, which ultimately
> calls java.lang.getDeclaredMethod() which only accepts an array of
> classes.  Since null is not a class, it throws an exception and thus
> the private method is declared not found.  Am I right?  Or am I
> missing something?
> 
> When I replaced the null with a valid object, it was able to find the
> private method fine.  Is this a bug, or is this something that I
> shouldn't be doing (setting null as an element in the Object array?).

In general, arrays can hold null values; but in this particular case, 
what is the null meant to signify? Why are you trying to pass null?
--
